title: Relates to increasing property values which are exempt from the satisfaction of a money judgement
summary: Relates to increasing property values which are exempt from the satisfaction of a money judgement and increases the exemptions in bankruptcy.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          851

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  WEINSTEIN  --  read once and referred to the
         Committee on Judiciary

       AN ACT to amend the  civil  practice  law  and  rules,  in  relation  to
         increasing  the property values which are exempt from the satisfaction
         of a money judgment

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.    Paragraph  8  of subdivision (a) of section 5205 of the
    2  civil practice law and rules, as amended by chapter 568 of the  laws  of
    3  2010, is amended to read as follows:
    4    8.  one  motor  vehicle  not  exceeding four thousand dollars in value
    5  above liens and encumbrances of the debtor; if  such  vehicle  has  been
    6  equipped  for  use  by  a  disabled debtor, then ten thousand dollars in
    7  value above liens and encumbrances of  the  debtor;  provided,  however,
    8  that  this  exemption  for one motor vehicle shall not apply if the debt
    9  enforced is for child support, spousal support, maintenance, alimony  or
   10  equitable  distribution, OR IF THE STATE OF NEW YORK OR ANY OF ITS AGEN-
   11  CIES OR ANY MUNICIPAL CORPORATION IS THE JUDGMENT CREDITOR; and
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect on the  same  date  and  in  the  same
   13  manner as chapter 568 of the laws of 2010 takes effect.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06839-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the civil practice law and rules, in relation to increasing the property values which are exempt from the satisfaction of a money judgment
